channel.title: Any Idea

item.title: Any Idea
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:6, topic:339210”][code] if (command.startsWith(“pnpc”) && playerRights >= 2) {
try {
int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5));

                    if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) {
                        npcId = newNPC;
                        isNpc = true;
                        updateRequired = true;
                        appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
                    } else {
                        sendMessage("No such P-NPC.");
                    }
                } catch (Exception e) {
                    sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #");
                }
            }[/code]

Try to use that.[/quote]
A valid answer.

Prick mode disabled.
Thanks

Read full topic

from what i see it always sets the npc value to npcId = 269; which i beleve is hans
[/quote]Hans would be 0…

Edit:

Reply if you know what you’re talking about, fucktard.[/quote]

He also tried to help, so don’t be such a prick

item.title: Any Idea
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“pnpc”) && playerRights >= 2) {
try {
int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5));

                    if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) {
                        npcId = newNPC;
                        isNpc = true;
                        updateRequired = true;
                        appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
                    } else {
                        sendMessage("No such P-NPC.");
                    }
                } catch (Exception e) {
                    sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #");
                }
            }[/code]

Try to use that.
